title: For Many Young Voters, Biden’s Support for Drilling in Alaska Casts a Long Shadow
description: Despite his aggressive moves to try to slash greenhouse gas emissions, President Biden has angered young climate voters upset by a drilling project in Alaska.

title: Ukraine’s Spring Offensive Comes With Immense Stakes for Future of the War
description: Without a decisive victory, Western support for Ukraine could weaken, and Kyiv could come under increasing pressure to enter serious peace talks to end or freeze the conflict.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: China Walks Back Ambassador’s Comments
description: Also, Beijing is trying to control chatbots and Thailand prepares for tense elections.

title: Miller High Life, ‘Champagne of Beer’, Cans Crushed in Europe
description: Customs authorities in Belgium forcibly recycled thousands of cans of America’s “go-to lowbrow beer of choice” after they took issue with its slogan: “the Champagne of Beers.”

title: Men in Military Uniforms Killed at Least 60 People, Burkina Faso Says
description: A prosecutor opened an investigation into the killing of about 60 people by men in uniforms of the national military. Days earlier, the authorities said they would investigate the killing of seven boys.

title: Kenyan Pastor at Center of Inquiry After Dozens of Bodies Are Exhumed
description: Many of the victims are believed to have been members of a church led by a pastor who is being investigated on allegations that he directed his congregants to starve themselves to death.

title: German Magazine Editor Is Fired Over Fake Michael Schumacher Interview
description: Die Aktuelle promoted an interview as the first with the retired Formula 1 driver since a 2013 accident. But artificial intelligence had generated the responses.

title: Statue Is Defaced in England After Children Were Given Crayons
description: A memorial and a statue of a water nymph that is more than 200 years old were covered in bright blue crayon marks, officials said.

title: Civilians Flee Fighting in Sudan for Troubled Neighboring Countries
description: The clashes have killed more than 400 people and injured thousands more. Those displaced are streaming into nations such as Chad, Egypt and South Sudan, adding to a refugee crisis in the region.

title: Putin’s Spokesman, Dmitri Peskov, Claims Son Fought in Ukraine
description: Dmitry S. Peskov’s comments highlighted the Moscow elite’s uneven participation in a war that has cost the lives of tens of thousands of Russian soldiers.

title: A Chinese Ambassador’s Comments on Ex-Soviet States Draw Ire
description: The Baltic States summoned Chinese representatives after China’s ambassador to France questioned the sovereignty of countries that declared independence from the Soviet Union.

title: Russian Foreign Minister to Appear at U.N. After Americas Tour
description: Sergey V. Lavrov is in New York on Monday after spending much of last week courting countries in Latin America. Here is what we’re covering:

title: How Strong Is the Economy?
description: The answer depends on how you measure success.

title: The Grandmaster Plan to Turn Hordes of Kids Into Chess Fanatics
description: Pandemic boredom and a Netflix mini-series, “The Queen’s Gambit,” played a part. But Chess.com was also plotting its own moves.

title: China Accuses Liberal Columnist of Espionage After a Lunch With Diplomat
description: Dong Yuyu was a longtime writer and editor at a top Chinese Communist Party newspaper who had frequently met with foreign diplomats and journalists.

title: Thaksin Shinawatra’s Daughter Enters Thailand Election
description: An ousted populist’s daughter seeks office, fueling concerns that the return of a divisive political dynasty may revive instability, too.

title: China Says Chatbots Must Toe the Party Line
description: The Communist Party outlined draft rules that would set guardrails on the rapidly growing industry of services like ChatGPT.

title: Coloring History’s Gray Areas, With Strong Moral Outrage
description: Éric Vuillard writes short historical narratives known for their irony. His latest, “An Honorable Exit,” delves into France’s defeat in the First Indochina War.

title: At Ukraine’s Gravesites, a Spring Ritual Hints at Renewal
description: A decimated village welcomes back displaced residents for a day of remembrance and hope.

title: DeSantis, an Enigma on Foreign Policy, Praises U.S.-Japan Ties in Tokyo
description: The Florida governor Ron DeSantis had a chance to buff up his foreign policy credentials, after criticism from fellow Republicans over his comments on Ukraine.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Evacuations of foreign officials from Sudan.
